com.navis.framework.portal

Class BizRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.portal.BizRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BizRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Encapsulates a generalized request of the Business tier from the Presentation tier. If you use setQueryTarget and a setUpdateTarget, the update target is executed first, then the query target.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • createDomainQuery

        @Deprecated
public static DomainQuery createDomainQuery(java.lang.String inEntityName)
        Deprecated. Use QueryUtils.createDomainQuery() instead.
        Factory Method for our generic 'domain query'.

      • setQueryTarget

        public void setQueryTarget(java.lang.String inSessionBean,
                           java.lang.String inBusinessMethod)
        Called to set the target for the 'query' portion of the request. As the name suggests, this is a READONLY request. Do not use this target for updating the target or the updates will not be flushed to the database.
        Parameters:
        inSessionBean - The session bean that will handle the request (the "target")
        inBusinessMethod - The method of the session bean that will handle the request (the "action")

      • setApiTarget

        public void setApiTarget(java.lang.String inApiName)
        convinience method for setting an ApiMapping to the request

        Throws BizFailure if API does not exist. Do not catch as this is a programming bug.

        Parameters:
        inApiName -

      • setUpdateTarget

        public void setUpdateTarget(java.lang.String inSessionBean,
                            java.lang.String inBusinessMethod)
        Called to set the target for the 'update' portion of the request.
        Parameters:
        inSessionBean - The session bean that will handle the request (the "target")
        inBusinessMethod - The method of the session bean that will handle the request (the "action")

      • getQueryTarget

        public java.lang.String getQueryTarget()
        gets the _queryTarget for this request. A traget is the session bean to which this request will be delegated to

        string representing the _queryTarget
